State class documentation¶

class state_machine.state.State(name, decision_function, routine_function=None, entry_function=None, exit_function=None, is_async=True, next_states=None)¶

This class represents the states that makes up the state machine.

name¶

The state name

Type

str

entry_function¶

A function that will be executed when the state machine’s state entry on this specific state

Type

function

routine_function¶

A function that will be executed on each interaction of the state machine when it stay on this specific state.

Type

function

exit_function¶

A function that will be executed when the state machine’s are leaving this this specific state

Type

function

decision_function¶

A function that decides, according to the object circunstancies, what state will be the next

Type

function

is_async¶

This flag indicates if these object functions should be performed as asynchronous (True) or not (False)

Type

bool

next_states¶

A list of States that could be the next.

Type

list

__eq__(other)¶

Verify if this object in equals to other

Parameters

other (State) –

Returns

True if both names match, False otherwise

Return type

bool

__init__(name, decision_function, routine_function=None, entry_function=None, exit_function=None, is_async=True, next_states=None)¶

State class initialization function.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The state name

  • decision_function (function) – A function that decides, according to the object circunstancies, what state will be the next

  • routine_function (function, optional) – A function that will be executed on each interaction of the state machine when it stay on this specific state. Defaults to None.

  • entry_function (function, optional) – A function that will be executed when the state machine’s state entry on this specific state. Defaults to None.

  • exit_function (function, optional) – A function that will be executed when the state machine’s are leaving this this specific state. Defaults to None.

  • is_async (bool, optional) – This flag indicates if these object functions should be performed as asynchronous (True) or not (False). Defaults to True.

  • next_states (list, optional) – A list of States that could be the next, if it’s None, the next states will not be verified when there’s a state transition. Defaults to None.

__repr__()¶

State class representation method

Returns

A string representation of the object

Return type

str

_parse_function_attr(var, attr)¶

Validates if the var is a callable object.

Parameters

  • var (function) – callable object

  • attr (str) – attribute name

Raises

ValueError – If arg ‘var’ is not callable

property decision_function¶

A function that decides, according to the object circunstancies, what state will be the next

Type

function

property entry_function¶

A function that will be executed when the state machine’s are leaving this this specific state

Type

function

property exit_function¶

A function that will be executed when the state machine’s are leaving this this specific state

Type

function

property is_async¶

This flag indicates if these object functions should be performed as asynchronous (True) or not (False)

Type

bool

is_next_state(state)¶

Verify if state is in the next_states attribute list

Parameters

state (State) –

Raises

ValueError – If state is not a State object

Returns

True if this State does not contains next states or state in the list, False otherwise

Return type

bool

property name¶

The state name

Type

str

property next_states¶

A list of States that could be the next, if it’s None, the next states will not be verified when there’s a state transition

Type

list

property routine_function¶

A function that will be executed on each interaction of the state machine when it stay on this specific state.

Type

function
